alert.note: Alert for Burke Mountains; Caldwell Mountains; Rutherford Mountains (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 22 at 9:08AM EST until December 24 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM FRIDAY TO 1 PM EST SATURDAY BELOW 3500 FEET... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY HAS EXPIRED... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. * WHERE...Caldwell Mountains, Burke Mountains and Rutherford Mountains Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 9 AM EST this morning. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 1 AM Friday to 1 PM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Advisory means that very cold air and strong winds will combine to generate low wind chills. This will result in frost bite and lead to hypothermia if precautions are not taken. If you must venture outdoors, make sure you wear a hat and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Burke Mountains; Caldwell Mountains; Rutherford Mountains
